meanings.sent1: The old bread was moldier than the fresh loaf.
meanings.sent2: The damp walls in the basement became moldier over time.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox grew moldier by the day.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a moldier smell than the rest of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The moldier cheese had to be thrown away immediately.

meanings.sent1: If you leave food out, it will moldier quickly.
meanings.sent2: The fruit started to moldier after a few days on the counter.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally let the bread moldier in the pantry.
meanings.sent4: Leaving wet clothes in a pile can cause them to moldier.
meanings.sent5: The damp towel began to moldier within hours.

meanings.sent1: The sculptor was a skilled moldier of clay.
meanings.sent2: The artist was known as a talented moldier of shapes.
meanings.sent3: The young moldier shaped the sand into a castle.
meanings.sent4: The experienced moldier crafted intricate designs with ease.
meanings.sent5: The creative moldier brought life to the dull material.
